website_summaries.verdict: The Z/2 Classic multi-sport sandal's greatness is due in no small part to its 5-star level of comfort and exemplary performance. Couple these with durability, a reassuring toe strap, and a healthy selection of colors, and wearers got themselves a fine hiker. However, users didn't like its cumbersome build and annoyingly time-consuming, adjustable straps. People also felt misled by its inconsistent sizing. In conclusion, Chaco’s Z/2 Classic has a lot going for it that tries to outshine the seemingly huge shadow of flaws casting over it.
pros: Adventurers by the dozens applauded this sandal’s amazing overall performance on the trail, be it wet or dry
According to a large number of wearers, the Chaco Z/2 Classic had a level of comfort that is simply off the charts
Users in droves greatly admired this strappy footwear for its sturdy construction
Based on a good number of reviews, the Z/2 Classic was a remarkably versatile hiking sandal
This product simply doesn’t disappoint when it comes to color variety, according to many reviewers
Some hikers deeply appreciated the added security brought forth by the Chaco Z/2 Classic’s toe strap
This hiking sandal is budget friendly, and a handful of purchasers couldn’t agree more
Its stunningly stylish looks were praised by several owners
According to a professional footwear critic, the Z/2 Classic’s arch support was the real deal
An expert reviewer found a dependably stabilizing platform in this sandal
cons: The Chaco Z/2 Classic failed to meet the expectations of many for running large
Some users were outraged by the sandal’s adjustable straps
They said it took them some time just to get the right configuration
A handful of users were left unimpressed with the sandal’s drawn-out break-in time
The Z/2 Classic’s weightiness didn’t sit well with a couple of testers
A very small percentage of reviewers, which include a Youtube vlogger, regarded the sandal’s ankle strap as bothersome
They said that, when strapped all the way in, its remainder drags on the ground—and irritatingly so

customer_reviews.title: Either Chacos have changed quality or these are not Chacos
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Chacos for years and even with daily wear they last two or three years. After two months this pair has already had the sole crack and is almost worn smooth. Also I have not had an opportunity to put miles on these, maybe 100 miles max. Previous Chacos lasted thousands of miles with very little wear. These are also smaller per size than the Chacos I purchase from REI, not a big deal since they fit me but odd.
customer_reviews.author: Scott R. Pitts

customer_reviews.title: ...not for me...
customer_reviews.text: ...Chaco brand sandals receive very high reviews across the board, but I found the soles on this version stiff and kinda hard - that 'clopped' when you walked on a hard wood surface. Putting them on was no easy task for me either - especially this style (on my size 13 feet). And I didn't like the big toe wrapping strap design. Once on, they did not feel secure... too many straps going in all directions! ;-) I'm sure other styles work fine, but I returned them and went for a pair of Tevas with a simpler and more sturdy design. Just a personal take.
customer_reviews.author: StephLadder

customer_reviews.title: Husband is a hiking sandal convert
customer_reviews.text: Husband thought it was useless excess now he says: comfortable, no break-in time, crucial for backpacking. He likes that he can just squash the toe loop if he doesn’t want to use it. Great for after the day’s hike is finished and he wanted to swim in the lake or walk the creek.
customer_reviews.author: J.G.C.

customer_reviews.title: Seriously? I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to adjust straps for a comfortable fit AND have blood flow in forefoot. The loose "tag drag" is really irritating. If I snug up to fit my foot without cutting off blood flow, I have 4 to 5 inches of loose strap that drags to the outside of each foot. Had to superglue some Velcro on the heel strap and tag end to keep them from underfoot. Very unstable when foot is wet. Starts unsafely sliding around underfoot in grass dew. Wanted them for the beach and activities like washing the car. Have to set that aside for safety.
customer_reviews.author: Hound of Ulster

customer_reviews.title: Great sandals for active folks
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband after having bought mine used and having them for 7 years. Read the size chart and you will get a good fit, adjust the straps as needed. They take a couple times to break in but are fantastic sandals. Chaco will also repair your sandals when time comes so you don't need to buy new ones. Just had mine repaired and we are set to have many more years of adventures. Might I also add that as a person with lots of foot issues, these offer great support with a really comfy foot bed.
customer_reviews.author: Tazi

customer_reviews.title: They shipped the wrong size.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the look and the quality build of the chaco as this was my first pair. Online I ordered as advertised a pair of women's size 12/men's 9.5 assuming I would receive a pair of men's 9.5. I received a pair of men's size 12. I'm returning the product and I am very disappointed because I was really looking forward to wearing them. This is how they were advertised so it's clearly a misprint or a mistake in their shipping department. Either way I'll have to order another pair. I'm a Little hesitant to order these again from the same supplier as I'm not sure if it's true what they are advertising.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Eubanks

customer_reviews.title: There's a reason outdoorsy people fan girl over these.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for a few months now and have fallen in love. I go hiking in them all the time and wear them pretty much all the time. They do have a break in period of about two weeks where your feet just need to build up the skin in the few slightly irritating parts but once they are broken in you will love them. They float in water and are very adjustable. When it gets cold I just flatten out the toe loop and turn them into socko's and haven't really had the discomfort that others have reported. Overall I am excited to get a lot more life out of these fantastic sandals.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Pawlak

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: My husband LOVES these Chacos. They were his only pair of shoes while we were in Europe for 3 months this summer! They are comfortable and versatile. We hiked, waded through water, climbed inactive volcanoes, walked on cobblestone streets, took them in the ocean, just about everywhere! They held up perfectly and he still wears them back home. We will continue buying chacos every time they go out!
customer_reviews.author: Melany

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these sandals probably 10-12 times now, and every time I walk in them for more than about 2 minutes the toe strap keeps getting tighter until it starts cutting circulation off in my toe. I have watched videos on how to adjust them and tried multiple times. They are uncomfortable besides that as well. I'm addition the extra strap constantly gets under my foot and won't stay rolled up. Worst pair of shoes I've ever owned, and expensive for what they are.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Size was perfect as was comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I had been wearing Tevas for years. Recently their sizing has gone way wrong. They rarely offer 1/2 sizes now and although I wear an 8-1/2 in every other brand, an 8 was huge (looked like swim flippers according to my wife) and a 7 was way to short. I had multiple pairs sent in case this was some sort of labeling mistake...(??). Finally I gave up and ordered these Chacos. Fit was perfect. Very comfortable with awesome arch support. Sorry Teva- write to me if you get your act together.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Not made in USA.
customer_reviews.text: Nice but takes some getting used to. Feels weird and I want to curl my big toe when I walk in them. Wanted the made in USA but what came was made in Dominican republic.
customer_reviews.author: casey stafford

customer_reviews.title: Not bad!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 13B, so I'd been looking for a sandal that was more secure than the typical Teva (when you have narrow feet, things tend to slip). The straps on these sandals do a pretty good job. The length is perfect, the width is, well, too wide, but I have to live with that. The only downside is that, with my narrow feet, there's a LOT of loose adjustment strap hanging out. It hasn't caused a problem and I don't expect it to, but it looks a little messy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer AMS

customer_reviews.title: The straps, they adjust!
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of Chacos already, but have had them for 7 years. They still last, to this day! However, there was no adjusting the straps. So, in the summer, my feet swell and it made it super uncomfortable. I gave my old pair to someone with smaller feet and got these new ones! They adjust accordingly and they don't strangle my toes. They give them enough room. The support of shoe is amazing! I have flat feet and these provide the same as if I was wearing insoles. Super amazed with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Miner-Babb

customer_reviews.title: Chaco 4 life
customer_reviews.text: I have been Chaco brand loyal since 2005. Since then they have been my go to shoe for camp ministry and they get a lot of mileage on them. I prefer the Z2 as it encompasses the toe giving a feeling of more hold to my foot. This does mean you have to get some calluses on your toe but if you know Chaco you know the old saying: "You don't break in Chacos, Chacos break in you."
customer_reviews.author: Dot

customer_reviews.title: good, but straps are confusing
customer_reviews.text: Spent countless time trying to get the straps to fit my feet. You cant trim the straps to fit, so you end up sliding the straps around the sides, through the sole, and all over creation. Heaven help you if your ankles are bigger or smaller than "normal" as you simply wont have enough webbing, or you will have so much excess webbing that you trip on it. Weird way to do things...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A shoe for the decade.
customer_reviews.text: My second pair in 12 years. First pair still going strong with decent tread. Wanted a nicer pair for office, church, hanging with friends. Old pair will remain my hikers. I say this to show the longevity. No shoe in my life has had the durability and flexibility of Chacos. I can walk, hike, swim, kayak in them. I can use them with a pair of jeans or chinos or shorts. Worth every penny of the $100 they cost because they are truly a decade shoe.
customer_reviews.author: pjtighe

customer_reviews.title: I expected it to last longer
customer_reviews.text: I used it almost everyday for 2 years before the outsole split from the midsole. Also, the "logo" has fallen out. The wear on the outside of the heel is probably due to my walking but I've expected more from something marketed as durable. My running shoes with over 800km of mileage have less wear. The straps are quite difficult to adjust most of the time. Pros: comfortable to wear; feet feel secure; feet don't sweat as much; straps are very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Aljo F.

customer_reviews.title: Women, don't be afraid to try the mens.
customer_reviews.text: I could never find chacos that fit correctly, I have fairly wide feet and even though the women's wide sandals were wide enough they just didn't fit well. Finally I got a pair of mens (not wide) and they fit perfect. They're durable, comfortable, and I think they look really nice. I saw several reviews on the women's version of these saying they never fit properly, well don't be afraid to try to men's sizes, just be sure to size down accordingly. (I'm a 9-10 in women's shoes, depending on the brand, I got an 8 in mens and they're perfect.)
customer_reviews.author: Jen Boring

customer_reviews.title: Would be great if the straps stayed in place
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these sandals and was initially impressed by the how well made they appear, however I have had constant problems with the toe loop continuing to tighten whilst walking, strangling my big toes. I have tried to persevere, wearing them in water and sandy environments in the hope that the straps will improve, but no such luck after several months. I feel that this is very poor for an expensive pair of footwear.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Papadop

customer_reviews.title: Not much of a SANDal
customer_reviews.text: Got these sandal for a vacation at lake powell. Wore them around the house and I thought they were they coolest sandal ever. I love how the straps adjusted it was super cool! I went on the vacation. Took a stroll on the sand and now the straps wont adjust. If anything the straps have tightened and I can barely get my foot in them. I don't know if sand got in them and jammed it up or something. But I have tried cleaning them and adjusting the straps. I would have hoped a SANDal would work in the sand. I recommend buying this SANDal but do not use it in the sand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've been a long time fan on chaco's and e Amazon often. These are by far the worst purchase I've made. For the price I spent n these vs what I received are 2 different thing. I would 100% definitely recommend you buy these local. They almost seem to be made out of leftover material. They dont fit correctly and the straps must be for a larger size. I'm returning thse asap. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THESE. BUY FROM A MORE RELIABLE RETAILER!!!
customer_reviews.author: MatthewCabler

customer_reviews.title: Maybe size down for narrow feet.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has narrow feet: the right shoe fit okay if tightened all the way down, but the left shoe was not able to be tightened enough to fit comfortably, so we had to send them back. Haven’t tried to get a smaller size yet to see if that will work or not.
customer_reviews.author: rikki

customer_reviews.title: Chaco's are the best
customer_reviews.text: Chacos are the best. I've had several pairs and even had some resoled. They're comfortable and I can walk or hike for hours without problem. They are very supportive and if you put them on after a pair of flatter shoes, it will feel uncomfortable when putting them on initially. But after some time you realize how badly you have been treating your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Cragun

customer_reviews.title: Chaco’s are the best!
customer_reviews.text: Chaco has great products and after wearing out a few pairs, which is hard to do, in was thrilled to find these and at an awesome price. Highly recommend the brand and any style you order. I mike the toe loop was it provides extra stability and it’s what I’m accustomed to.
customer_reviews.author: D. Terry

customer_reviews.title: Wash first
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair 12 years ago and they had vibram soles. They lasted over a decade. I noticed chaco now makes their own soles. He fit has somewhat changed as I experienced rubbing near the heel. I washed them on a gentle cycle and it softened up the sole a little which reduced the rubbing but it's clear something has changed.
customer_reviews.author: Rob_B

customer_reviews.title: Popularity cheapened the product
customer_reviews.text: This is the last pair of chaos I will buy. They've cheapened the product and it's not only less durable, but they now skimp on the straps, too! The straps aren't as adjustable as they once we're and now they aren't even long enough and they've made the opening more narrow! We're still paying the same price, or more, and the quality and ease of the sandles has tanked significantly in the past couple of years, what a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Crissy Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoe for 1 pair backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes. I got these for a 2 week trip to the Philippines and they were amazing. Jungle hikes, reef snorkeling and city streets, they were up to any environment I could throw at them. They do get a bit funky but it's nothing some baking soda or w/e you like to use can't fix
customer_reviews.author: Dion de Kok

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly well-made sandals
customer_reviews.text: These are some extremely high-quality sandals. They have some weight to them, the tread’s are like off-road Ing Tires and the straps are sick and dependable. I’ve even taken some 3 to 4 hour hikes in the sandals after giving my feet a few weeks to get accustomed to the straps. They have a tendency to get a little smelly with bare feet But are usually washed. I will have the sandals for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie K

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable once broken in
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 9.5 and was hesitant on which size to order. I chose the 9 which worked out perfectly. I have high arches and this sandal works perfect for my feet. It does take time getting used to the strapping system (since this is my first pair of Chacos...) Overall, I love them. Durability is still a question since I’ve only had them for 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: 325iM54B30WHAT

customer_reviews.title: The fit isn't right
customer_reviews.text: I have a relatively flat foot. Not completely flat, but flat enough that these were unwearable. Very noticable hot spot on the arch when wearing. I would recommend these for someone with a normal arch or very thin feet. Best of luck!
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: Went to rei and tried on the 14's and they were a much better fit. Gave it 5 stars as it's not ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 13 to 14 depending on the shoe. Everything I read about Chacos said they run large. I didn't find that to be true. The 13's were too small. Went to rei and tried on the 14's and they were a much better fit. Gave it 5 stars as it's not Chacos fault, my foot is just different.
customer_reviews.author: Dan T.

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for the outdoor lover
customer_reviews.text: Chacos are a great way to face the outdoors. Was not aware when buying these that the heel rubs the sole of the Chaco causing four massive blisters that were extremely painful. After a few days the blisters turned into calluses, after that they turned out to be quite nice shoes. I don't recommend wearing them for long walks or hikes. They work great for traveling to hot countries, they were great to wear if your feet are naturally hot.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Best product,  perfect seller!
customer_reviews.text: Been traveling with them for months, see the website sizing, they are supportive and safe, nothing like flip flops, I've walked at max speed for a few hours , rode motos, wash in shower, Great quality, perfect seller, exactly as described, early deliver!
customer_reviews.author: OnlineCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: This sandal is heavy. I've always heard great things about Chaco's and was nervous about buying these before trying and was right to be. I would have never purchased these if I tried them on first due to the weight of the sandal.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy K.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and fits good
customer_reviews.text: Bought these sandals for my granddaughter who has a supper wide foot. She wears a women’s size 9 EE. Very hard to find cute shoes in that size for a 20-year-old who wants to look.youthful, not like a grandma. I decided to try a men’s shoe for extra width. Black was the only color I could find. She loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Reta T

customer_reviews.title: True size with moderate arch support
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy these. They fit great after some small adjustments. I have flat feet and you could feel the arch support. It was slightly uncomfortable after hours of wearing, but otherwise they feel great.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: The only sandals you need.
customer_reviews.text: I bought my last part of chacos more than a decade ago. After countless adventures, it was finally time for a new pair. These new footbeds are a bit softer than the old ones, but they still feel great. I look forward to another decade of use and abuse without all the refuse.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Baker

customer_reviews.title: Really great quality
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted these sandals, saved up for them and has worn them almost exclusively since they arrived. They are high quality and stand up to the punishment that a very active 14 year old boy gives them. They were very reasonable priced as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amy g

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat this price for classic, reliable sandals
customer_reviews.text: I live in a desert country that has a number of fun water hikes. These foot the bill admirably. But, you already knew that from the "Chaco" written on the side. Got these for about $56 in classic black, which means I got a steal, in my opinion. Believe all the positives you read about the Chaco Z2 Classic.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Roode

customer_reviews.title: Annoying Toe Loop
customer_reviews.text: I sent these back as this style has a toe loop which is annoying. Reordered the Z1 which I have had for 10 years. Got the Z1 yesterday and it fits great. Order one size larger to keep your toes inside the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny

customer_reviews.title: durable, supportive
customer_reviews.text: Edit after a few months; midsole seems softer, and definitely STINKS more than my older pairs. Squishy stinky, not a good combo. A cost-out or "improvement"? Sigh. 3rd pair in 15 years. Bombproof. Only need new because my pronation wears heel down. Still keep old pairs in trucks for backup. Dont like the sole for water sports, but for everything else (beside heavy backpacking) these are my only summer shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Terrill Bruce Hope

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Perfect sandals to be worn outside, lifeguarding, Yes, the straps are long, but I watched a video on how to hide the straps behind and it's perfect. A Satisfied Guy
customer_reviews.author: flirty girl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sandal for tropical weather!
customer_reviews.text: This sandal is perfect for tropical weather. I have used the Z1 for years and thought I would try the Z2 to get more grip on the big toe. It works well and is very comfortable. Being able to adjust the straps to your desired tightness is also a big plus. Great sandal.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Much Heavier than expected
customer_reviews.text: Sandal was much heavier than expected, and not a fan of the toe wrap around strap.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh A

customer_reviews.title: Loving Them
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves the toe as it keeps his foot secure. He has had no strap slip like I have had with my Z1Clouds. He thinks the sole is a little too firm but expects them to soften with wear. He sized up 1/2 size (as he did with his Keen's and they fit perfectly Very nice looking and go with everything.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine Girl

customer_reviews.title: Chaco are great
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my husband because I love mine. We live in Louisiana and the heat and humidity make closed shoes and socks very hot. He has bad feet and had to work to adjust them for his feet. He is still getting used to them
customer_reviews.author: A. Perry

customer_reviews.title: A very sturdy Shoe....
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Tevas and they hold up very well. But if you’re not used to the style of the arch support your feet may be sore for a while when you first start wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: LisaB

customer_reviews.title: Odd arch and foot curvature.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get over the stiff arch. It felt like my foot needed to curl inward to make this fit. I opted to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Schnautz

customer_reviews.title: Having problem with the toe
customer_reviews.text: I love these sandals but as I used them to the beach since August 2016.. for some reason I am having a hard time putting on my right big toe to the webbing like the it shrunk. If anyone can tell me how I can fix it. Give me a shoutout. If you see from the photo my right big toe side is tighter than the left one
customer_reviews.author: alfred

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow now
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair of chacos that I've owned. They have changed the foot bed so they come up around the heel and now they pinch my heel. I really liked the more flatter older style. I guess in done buy chacos seems like that's how they are now. Back to wearing tevas
customer_reviews.author: Beetleman

customer_reviews.title: Blue, not black
customer_reviews.text: I like them, but the straps are more of a blue then a black on gray. I am keeping them but a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Pappas

customer_reviews.title: Good for walking
customer_reviews.text: These things are comfortable and last. Have walked many miles in many environments (from Iceland to Mexico, as in both of them, not a direct path) and these things are still going strong. The last 2 pair of sandals I had broke after 9-12 months, these are good.
customer_reviews.author: Christianwins

customer_reviews.title: Buy a size down
customer_reviews.text: Chacos are great, if you don't have a pair of chacos you definitely need some. You can literally do anything in these. I would highly recommend buying a size down from what your regular shoe size is. I normally wear a 10 when it comes to tennis shoes and I bought a size 9 chaco and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kyler S

customer_reviews.title: Great Chacos and great price!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! The color was a little darker than I thought but my husband loved them!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Cross

customer_reviews.title: good support for a sandal
customer_reviews.text: Love the way they fit and support the foot. Also great for hiking when in and out of water on a trail.
customer_reviews.author: Ozma

customer_reviews.title: Send the right color please
customer_reviews.text: I disliked that I ordered my favorite colors (green and blue) and was so happy when they arrived....I opened the box and saw an ugly rust/brown color. What a disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Karen Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE! Ordered for my boyfriend and he loves them as well. Great quality came with box and care information card. Very nice!
customer_reviews.author: Maddy frankum

customer_reviews.title: Walking Cool
customer_reviews.text: Very good sandal. Just what I expected since I had a pair for years just like this one. Thanks for making the same good shoes over time.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Stoffle

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with a classic.
customer_reviews.text: These are a classic must for outdoor lovers and casual walkers. Great addition to any camping or beach excursion.
customer_reviews.author: Mama LisaK

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I like these sandals! It took a little time to get used to the strap system, but I wear the everyday. They are a good purchase
customer_reviews.author: jbcalvert

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price!
customer_reviews.text: These "athletic sandals" are just that. They stay comfortably 'glued' to your foot no matter how strenuous the activity. The only sandal that I would rate as just as stable as a shoe!
customer_reviews.author: B Q

customer_reviews.title: Well built sandals
customer_reviews.text: Chaco’s are our go to footwear for canoeing and kayaking. I like the fact that you can adjust all the straps to your feet and from that point forward you just have to tighten the top strap.
customer_reviews.author: Ross R.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Extremely heavy. Uncomfortable and painful if worn more than 2 or 3 hrs.
customer_reviews.author: phil

customer_reviews.title: Great pair if sandals
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality of the sandals & how well it fits. Suggest anyone who’s in between sizes consider sizing down. I am a US 9.5 and I got a size 9.
customer_reviews.author: ALASTAIR TAN

customer_reviews.title: So far...so good!
customer_reviews.text: Packaging damaged. Arrived with no label. Supposed to be a 10wide. No idea if they are the ordered size.Heel is a bit narrow but.. it’s only been a day of wearing. So far I’m pleased. Hoping they will soften with wear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent gentle but foot spreading arch support that feels awesome and very sturdy but comfortable foot bed
customer_reviews.author: johnny

customer_reviews.title: Would reccomend
customer_reviews.text: Much lighter in weight than I expected. They were a great addition to daily travel. One thing is the toe strap would cinch down as the day went on. Had to continually loosen the big toe strap. Cool colors and I'm excited to have them
customer_reviews.author: Travis Koch

customer_reviews.title: Forced to return
customer_reviews.text: I am unable to provide quality feedback, do to an accident that happened a number of years ago, my foot no longer sits properly, I was unable to wear the foot wear do to the heal pocket.
customer_reviews.author: apcapps

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable sandal with strong arch support
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes with good support and thick sole for hiking boating and camping.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Water proof shoe for planters faciiatis
customer_reviews.text: One of the better ones for planters faciiatis and it's water friendly. For me, arch could be higher and heal a little more cushioned.
customer_reviews.author: bob cameron

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe guy for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: My son has developed plantar fasciitis and his Dr reccomend Chacos for summer playing and camp. He has really enjoyed them and they hold his feet to keep them out of pain. They have been a great show for him this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Pittard

customer_reviews.title: Fit my wide at toes feet perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would post a picture of my “Toe” sandals with Toe socks. Which I could find no way to submit. Toe socks may be necessary for early spring weather. Toe socks may also assist with break-in....I bought 9W’s which fit my, wide at toes feet, perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas M Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: Takes assimilation but they’re great
customer_reviews.text: Takes some wearing to get your foot used to it. I have lower arches and it definitely takes getting used to, but once you do they’re great. Also, my foot measures a 13, bought a 14, fits great.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Schrader

customer_reviews.title: Can wear them comfortable all day in any weather condition
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my boyfriend and he loves them. Can wear them comfortable all day in any weather condition. This was his first pair of Chacos. I'm on my 5th or 6th pair. One pair I've had for 10 years now (re-webbed once). Absolutely love these sandals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy sandals
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best sandals ever. Sturdy with straps that adjust to your feet. Made for hiking but cute enough to wear every day.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.Mercy

customer_reviews.title: Too much money of a pair of sandals that cause me to whimper when I step.
customer_reviews.text: I hate these. My first pair of chacos and even after months of wearing they wear massive blisters into the sides of my feet!
customer_reviews.author: Mathew

customer_reviews.title: Love these sandals
customer_reviews.text: Love these sandals! The caveat is that it is hard to justify the price, at the end of the day, this is literally a good sole with some web strapping going through it. Would be 5 stars if price point sat around $60-$80.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Highly satisfied with these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely satisfied with these Chacos, they were very comfortable and fit my feet very well, they are very supportive and easy to walk in. I walked on rough terrain for a week with these shoes and was extremely impressed. Highly recommend these Chacos (Chaco Z2 Filmstrip Copper)
customer_reviews.author: Basik

customer_reviews.title: These are some of the doofiest looking sandals I've ever ...
customer_reviews.text: These are some of the doofiest looking sandals I've ever tried on. Not sure why practical sandals for men look so doofy.
customer_reviews.author: P. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Great sandal overall
customer_reviews.text: Great sandal overall. Only complaints are they are too heavy and the toe strap is kind of uncomfortable after a few hours of walking in them. But that's probably because I'm used to sandals without a toe strap.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Best sandal on Earth (probably)
customer_reviews.text: I love Chacos. These work great. Your feet don't stink after wearing them (like other sport sandals) and you can hike through rivers, play frisbee, and go up a mountain in these without any problems. Best sandal on Earth (probably)
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Burt

customer_reviews.title: Supportive, comfy shoes
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes. It took about 2 days before my feet adjusted to how supportive these shoes are, but my back already feels better from having these good shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Beal

customer_reviews.title: Love these things, great even after ~1 year
customer_reviews.text: Chacos are sturdy and reliable sandals. The straps are strong and stay in place so you do not have to keep adjusting them as you walk. I will buy these again whenever this pair decides to give out but that will probably be in a few years. Or I might just get more colors!
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Almost returned them a few days after I bought them. They were very uncomfortable in the start for me since my feet are flatter. After breaking them in, they are wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley A Lyles

customer_reviews.title: Great footwear
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased as replacements for a previous pair that lasted me 4 summers of near-constant wear. Great and comfortable, long lasting and just right for all summer events. Beach, bars, trails, you name it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Finlay

customer_reviews.title: Chaco Men's Z2 Classic Sport Sandal, Midnight, 8 M very stylish
customer_reviews.text: Chaco Men's Z2 Classic Sport Sandal, Midnight, 8 M is a fine sandal even though I usually wear a 9. They are stylish and comfortable. Looking forward to wearing them on vacation and summer time.
customer_reviews.author: HL

customer_reviews.title: Great sandals but string always break in the second year.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable sandals with great support. As i travel a lot these sandals are great for in the water and even light hiking. The toe loop is great and makes it for a tight fit when needed. After about 18 months the string get torn up. This is my third pair.
customer_reviews.author: willem

customer_reviews.title: Fit was poor
customer_reviews.text: Way too narrow for my foot. Length is good but arch hits about an inch to far to the rear. Really weird fit for the listed size and I have pretty normal feet.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M Harris

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t live up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Chacos as an alternative to Tevas. I’ve heard they’re superior. Perhaps other models are, but not these. I’ve worn these for two days and have blisters on multiple part of my feet. The toe loop makes it quite cumbersome to put them on.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Parry

customer_reviews.title: Last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my husband. He’s still wearing a pair that are at least 9 yrs old. These things last forever if taken care of! He’s very happy with the new addition now. They fit very well and the color is classic.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Just got them and already love them
customer_reviews.text: I had heard it can take a while to break these in before they are comfortable to wear but that has not been my experience so far. They're really comfortable! Love em.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M.

customer_reviews.title: It is a nice looking sandal
customer_reviews.text: The sandal looks very good. The sandal is made well. I found the style very uncomfortable. I sent the shoe back and an well satisfied with customer service.
customer_reviews.author: singleton

customer_reviews.title: Z/2s are Men's Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Z/2 classic in "forest," and while it fits me well enough that I'm keeping it, it should be noted that the three sandals (forest, patchwork, and metal) shown in this listing are men's shoes. Not women's. So if you are a woman looking at them, you might want to size down a bit.
customer_reviews.author: K. Foord

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my son, good color and fit , very comfortable, good buying experience from supplier
customer_reviews.author: Lee C

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband for his birthday and now I can’t return them but they don’t adjust like they’re supposed to and they cut into his foot. It’s like the strap is glued down instead of loose like it’s supposed to be.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa

customer_reviews.title: great fit. https
customer_reviews.text: Chaco Men's Z2 Classic Sport Sandal, Rapid service, great fit.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Has toe holder and feels odd.
customer_reviews.text: Beware this has the toe holder. Not comfortable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jmol

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: These Chacos did not disappoint. I bought a pair for myself and loved them so much that I bought a pair for my son. They are comfortable and durable. They are true to size and exactly what we wanted. We will definitely buy this product again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Watkins

customer_reviews.title: but it looks to be just fine. Like most footwear
customer_reviews.text: A little early to give a complete review, but it looks to be just fine. Like most footwear, there is a break-in period. I made a good guess on the sizing. THX
customer_reviews.author: oldSailor

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer for 15+ years
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my last pair of Chaco's. I loved my old pair for more than a decade, but the sole separated. The straps in this new pair are softer and are more comfortable. These shoes work great wet or dry and are great for every day wear as well as light hiking and watersports.
customer_reviews.author: T. Fenton

product_meta.title: Chaco Mens Z/2 Classic
product_meta.description: Streamlined and dependable since 1989, our Classic series is comprised of only 8 component parts, making for the simple, timeless sandal design that made our name. Every pair comes standard with adjustable straps that custom-fits to your foot, a toe-loop for additional forefoot control, plus our podiatrist-certified LUVSEAT PU footbed for all-day comfort and support. Now featuring ChacoGrip rubber for our best performing Classic outsole to date. Experience our Classic Sandal like never before
feature_bullets: Polyester jacquard webbing upper wraps around the foot and through the midsole along with a toe loop for a secure fit for a customized fit
Adjustable and durable high-tensile webbing heel risers
Non-marking ChacoGrip rubber outsole with 3.5mm deep lug
